casebody.data:
ELEANOR ROTENBURY, PLAINTIFF, v. JAMES HUNT, DEFENDANT. Submitted January term, 1928 Decided June 21, 1928.

Before Gummere, Chief Justice, and Justices Black and Lloyd.

For the plaintiff, Patrick H. Harding. For the defendant, Howard L. Miller. Per Curiam.

The defendant obtained a rule to show cause why the verdict rendered in this case in favor of the plaintiff for $5,000 for personal injuries and against the defendant should not be set aside and a new trial granted.

We think none of the reasons alleged for a new trial are tenable. The rule to show cause is discharged, with costs.
